funkatronics.code.tactilewaves.dsp.toolbox

Class Window

  • java.lang.Object
    • funkatronics.code.tactilewaves.dsp.toolbox.Window

  • public class Window
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for windowing sample buffers

    Arrays of both double and float are supported. Hamming, Hann, Blackman, Flat-top, Gaussian, and Kaiser windows are available. All windows are meant to be used for spectral analysis and are therefore periodic (DFT-even).

    See Also:
    WaveFrame

    • Constructor Detail

      • Window

        public Window(int windowType)
        Construct a new Window instance with the specified window type.
        Parameters:
        windowType - the window type to use. Valid window types are WINDOW_HANN, WINDOW_HAMMING, WINDOW_BLACKMAN, WINDOW_FLATTOP, WINDOW_GAUSSIAN, or WINDOW_KAISER.

      • Window

        public Window()
        Construct a new Window instance with a rectangular window

    • Method Detail

      • getWindowType

        public int getWindowType()
        Get the window type associated with this Window instance.
        Returns:
        the window type. Valid window types are WINDOW_HANN, WINDOW_HAMMING, WINDOW_BLACKMAN, WINDOW_FLATTOP, WINDOW_GAUSSIAN, or WINDOW_KAISER.

      • setWindowType

        public void setWindowType(int windowType)
        Set the window type of this Window instance.
        Parameters:
        windowType - the window type to use. Valid window types are WINDOW_HANN, WINDOW_HAMMING, WINDOW_BLACKMAN, WINDOW_FLATTOP, WINDOW_GAUSSIAN, or WINDOW_KAISER.

      • gaussian

        public static float[] gaussian(float[] x,
                               double alpha)
        Windows a signal using a Gaussian window with alpha to adjust the window width. Alpha is proportional to the standard deviation of the resulting window sigma = (N-1)/2*alpha.
        Parameters:
        x - the signal array to be windowed
        alpha - alpha value to adjust window width
        Returns:
        the windowed signal

      • gaussian

        public static double[] gaussian(double[] x,
                                double alpha)
        Windows a signal using a Gaussian window with alpha to adjust the window width. Alpha is proportional to the standard deviation of the resulting window sigma = (N-1)/2*alpha.
        Parameters:
        x - the signal array to be windowed
        alpha - alpha value to adjust window width
        Returns:
        the windowed signal
